definition: a mountain of paperwork and a sea of meetings (idiom)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Many jobs involve attending meetings, at least occasionally.
sentences.chinese: 很多工作都要经历文山会海，至少是经常性的。

definition: more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
drab, stereotypical Communist Party writing style
"three public expenditures" of the PRC government, i.e. air travel, food and entertainment, and public vehicles
to embezzle by adding to the payroll employees existing in name only
to discuss guidelines/to discuss principles to be followed
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
